discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/task/t_EMViewAlert.html

questions.question_text: Where would you find the Priority Breakdown for an Alert?
Where does an operator give feedback on an automated alert grouping?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This Feedback field appears in alert forms only if the alert being modified is a parent alert. Your response provides feedback about the accuracy and usefulness of the group. Possible values are:
- None
- No Feedback
- Yes

Selected Answer: E
Feel like the exam would pick E over D

choices.D: Feedback attribute on the alert record
choices.B: Feedback attribute on the child alert record
choices.E: Dropdown box on the alert group record
choices.C: Feedback attribute on the event record
choices.A: Feedback attribute on the virtual alert record

questions.question_text: In your environment, no alert CMDB, automated, or text based grouping is occurring. What is most likely the problem?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
To enable creating automated alert groups, set the Enable alert aggregation for Automated, CMDB and Text based groups (sa_analytics.aggregation_enabled)

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/concept/c_SACorrelatedAlertGroups.html

Selected Answer: E
The sa_analytics.aggregation_enabled parameter. Enable creating automated alert group by setting the Enable alert aggregation for Automated, CMDB and Text based groups property to true.

choices.A: No correlation rules have been defined
choices.E: The alert correlation property that enables grouping is set to false
choices.B: No event management rules have been defined

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is more proper.
Although A, C, D are all valid JSON, but we should always refer to the existing way ServiceNow supported. In the Now Learning it is stated:
- Supported JSON format "{"MEMORY";"70"}"

Selected Answer: C
A, C, and D are all valid JSON (A is also valid because integers do not necessarily have to be in quotes).

However, note that at this time, ServiceNow only accepts up to ES5 JSON (not ES6 yet), and while there are still three correct answers, C is the most correct, because most examples on the SN doc sites display concatenated k/v pairs more often than not. Examples here:

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-integrate-applications/page/administer/import-sets/reference/json-data-source-examples.html
C and D are both correct?

comments.content: i guess the "" makes D even more correct. But integers do not have to be in quotes, i believe.
